newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Czech PM Klaus says crown will not be devalued.
newsitem.headline: Czech PM Klaus says crown will not be devalued.

text.p: Czech Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus on Wednesday rejected calls for a devaluation of the domestic currency and said a weakening of the crown was neither desirable nor necessary.
"We think that a devaluation is not necessary and that it wouldn't be useful," Klaus told Reuters during an economic conference in this Tyrolean mountain village.
There have been repeated calls in the Czech Republic for a weaker crown to help boost exports and stem the country's ballooning current account deficit.

Klaus' comments came after Czech National Bank Governor Josef Tosovsky last week said the central bank was committed to keeping the crown within its 7.5 percent fluctuation bands around a central mark/dollar rate.
"We will stick to this level for the future," Klaus said. -- Knut Engelmann, Alpbach newsroom +43 5336 5597
